lines.text: I haven't been this happy since it was okay to take drugs.
Oh, well at least I was faithful!
Yeah, you were faithful like a Kennedy was faithful!
You know what the twenties are for? Having sex with all the wrong people. Not to get married.
What people want in a marriage is what I call emotional valet parking.
It is important to dialogue and to language with each other.
I told you, I have to be on top. I have back problems.
Among other things.
Phew, I need a drink. Waiter, get over here! No, not you, the young one.
[Keith and Molly just discovered her parents together in the next room]
I thought they hated each other?
Well, they're supposed to.

[after seeing a red hair on Keith's jacket]
Rowena! You're shedding again!

[Dan has just returned from what Rowena assumes was a fight with Lillian]
Are you all right? You don't even have to talk about it. It must have been awful, trapped out there with that wicked tongue. Well, I hope you gave it right back to her as good as she gave it.

[pauses and smiles to himself]
Oh, I know I did!
I'm not neurotic, I'm just a bitch.

[At the airport after giving her parents the plane tickets]
What are you doing?
Annulling your ass!

[to Molly]
You're just like them!

[Smiles mischievously]
Not yet!
[to Joey]
Let's go!
